docs.title: Notes
docs.text: Just some notes.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Complex Number Struct
docs.text:
struct comp {
  double x, y;
  comp(double x = .0, double y = .0) : x(x), y(y) {}
  inline comp conj() { return comp(x, -y); }
};

inline comp operator +(const comp& a, const comp& b) {
  return comp(a.x + b.x, a.y + b.y);
}

inline comp operator -(const comp& a, const comp& b) {
  return comp(a.x - b.x, a.y - b.y);
}

inline comp operator *(const comp& a, const comp& b) {
  return comp(a.x * b.x - a.y * b.y, a.x * b.y + a.y * b.x);
}

inline comp operator /(const comp& a, const double& b) {
  return comp(a.x / b, a.y / b);
}

It defines a complex number struct, and its +, -, *, / calculation.

docs.title: precalc
docs.text:
const double PI = acosl(-1.0);
vector<comp> w[LOGN];
vector<int> rv;

void precalc() {
  forn(st, LOGN) {
    w[st].resize(1 << st);
    forn(i, 1 << st) {
      double ang = PI / (1 << st) * i;
      w[st][i] = comp(cos(ang), sin(ang));
    }
  }

  rv.assign(1 << LOGN, 0);
  fore(i, 1, sz(rv)) {
    rv[i] = (rv[i >> 1] >> 1) | ((i & 1) << (LOGN - 1));
  }
}

w means omega, means rotation factors.

\[ e^{\frac{2\pi i}{n}} \]

Here only pi because we divide to 2. st means n. w[st][i] is the value in complex number. rv is reverse bits, size = 2^LOGN. if 5 in 4 bits(0101), rv will be 10(1010).

docs.title: multiply
docs.text:
int ln = 1;
while (ln < (sza + szb)) {
  ln <<= 1;
}

forn(i, ln) {
  aa[i] = (i < sza ? a[i] : comp());
}
forn(i, ln) {
  bb[i] = (i < szb ? b[i] : comp());
}

if a, b polynomial is power 2 and 3 sza + szb = 5 we get minimal 2^3 = 8 > 5 ln = 8

then we copy a to aa, other in 0

fft(aa, ln, false);
fft(bb, ln, false);

forn(i, ln) {
  cc[i] = aa[i] * bb[i];
}

fft(cc, ln, true);

szc = ln;
forn(i, szc) {
  c[i] = int(cc[i].x + 0.5);
}
do fft on aa and bb multiply aa and bb do reverse fft on cc normalize cc becuase it's double, use rounding to get int

docs.title: fft
docs.text:
int ln = __builtin_ctz(n);
forn(i, n) {
  int ni = rv[i] >> (LOGN - ln);
  if (i < ni)
    swap(a[i], a[ni]);
}


int ni = rv[i] >> (LOGN - ln);
get ln = log2(n) get a[idx], idx = reverse bit 

for(int st = 0; st < ln; st++) {
  int len = 1 << st;
  for(int k = 0; k < n; k+=(len << 1)) {
    fore(pos, k, k+len) {
      comp l = a[pos];
      comp r = a[pos+len] * w[st][pos-k];

      a[pos] = l + r;
      a[pos+len] = l - r;
    }
  }
}


for(int st = 0; st < ln; st++)
st = each steps, in this img = 3

int len = 1 << st;
len = stride = \(2^{st}\), in this img, 1, 2, 4

for(int k = 0; k < n; k+=(len << 1))
k = how many steps in each st, in this img, 4, 2, 1

fore(pos, k, k+len) {
  comp l = a[pos];
  comp r = a[pos+len] * w[st][pos-k];

  a[pos] = l + r;
  a[pos+len] = l - r;
}
calculation

if (inv) {
  forn(i, n) {
    a[i] = a[i] / n;
  }
  reverse(a+1, a+n);
}
reverse fft

docs.title: Full Code
docs.text:
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
using namespace std;

#define fore(i, l, r) for(int i = int(l); i < int(r); i++)
#define forn(i, n) for(int i = 0; i < int(n); i++)
#define sz(a) int((a).size())

const int LOGN = 19;
const int N = (1 << LOGN) + 555;

struct comp {
  double x, y;
  comp(double x = .0, double y = .0) : x(x), y(y) {}
  inline comp conj() { return comp(x, -y); }
};

inline comp operator +(const comp& a, const comp& b) {
  return comp(a.x + b.x, a.y + b.y);
}

inline comp operator -(const comp& a, const comp& b) {
  return comp(a.x - b.x, a.y - b.y);
}

inline comp operator *(const comp& a, const comp& b) {
  return comp(a.x * b.x - a.y * b.y, a.x * b.y + a.y * b.x);
}

inline comp operator /(const comp& a, const double& b) {
  return comp(a.x / b, a.y / b);
}

namespace FFT {
const double PI = acosl(-1.0);
vector<comp> w[LOGN];
vector<int> rv;

void precalc() {
  forn(st, LOGN) {
    w[st].resize(1 << st);
    forn(i, 1 << st) {
      double ang = PI / (1 << st) * i;
      w[st][i] = comp(cos(ang), sin(ang));
    }
  }

  rv.assign(1 << LOGN, 0);
  fore(i, 1, sz(rv)) {
    rv[i] = (rv[i >> 1] >> 1) | ((i & 1) << (LOGN - 1));
  }
}

inline void fft(comp a[N], int n, bool inv) {
  int ln = __builtin_ctz(n);
  forn(i, n) {
    int ni = rv[i] >> (LOGN - ln);
    if (i < ni)
      swap(a[i], a[ni]);
  }

  for(int st = 0; st < ln; st++) {
    int len = 1 << st;
    for(int k = 0; k < n; k+=(len << 1)) {
      fore(pos, k, k+len) {
        comp l = a[pos];
        comp r = a[pos+len] * w[st][pos-k];

        a[pos] = l + r;
        a[pos+len] = l - r;
      }
    }
  }

  if (inv) {
    forn(i, n) {
      a[i] = a[i] / n;
    }
    reverse(a+1, a+n);
  }

}

comp aa[N], bb[N], cc[N];
inline void multiply(int a[N], int sza, int b[N], int szb, int c[N], int& szc) {
  int ln = 1;
  while (ln < (sza + szb)) {
    ln <<= 1;
  }

  forn(i, ln) {
    aa[i] = (i < sza ? a[i] : comp());
  }
  forn(i, ln) {
    bb[i] = (i < szb ? b[i] : comp());
  }

  fft(aa, ln, false);
  fft(bb, ln, false);

  forn(i, ln) {
    cc[i] = aa[i] * bb[i];
  }

  fft(cc, ln, true);

  szc = ln;
  forn(i, szc) {
    c[i] = int(cc[i].x + 0.5);
  }
}

}

int main() {
  int a[N] = {1, 2, 3};
  int b[N] = {4, 5, 6};
  int c[N];

  FFT::precalc();

  int szc;
  FFT::multiply(a, 3, b, 3, c, szc);

  forn(i, szc) {
    cout << c[i] << " ";
  }
  cout << "\n";

  return 0;
}

docs.title: Arch Linux Dual Boot with Windows 11
Preparation on Windows 11
docs.text:
We will install Windows 11 first, then Arch Linux.

We need at least 512MB EFI partition in Arch Linux, so we will create a 1GB EFI system during Windows 11 Installation.

Reference

To create a 1GB EFI boot system:

  1. remove all the partitions
  2. shift + f10 to open cmd

and then

diskpart
list disk
sel disk 1
create partition efi size=1024
format quick fs=fat32 label=System
exit

and then keep installing Windows 11.

docs.title: Create Live USB for Arch Linux
docs.text:
Now for Arch Linux.

First, we need to allocate some space for Arch Linux, so we go to disk management, and shrink the Windows 11 we installed, like 200GB.

and then create Live USB for Arch Linux, balenaEtcher

When install Arch Linux, if you need wifi, type iwctl

iwctl
device list
station wlan0 scan
station wlan0 get-networks
station wlan0 connect IAN2

and then ping google.com to test

docs.title: Config Before Installation
docs.text:
Note

make terminal font bigger

cd /usr/share/kbd/consolefonts/
setfont ter-d20b.psf.gz

in /etc/makepkg.conf

MAKEFLAGS="-j$(expr $(nproc) \+ 1)"

in /etc/pacman.conf

Color
ParallelDownloads = 5

[core]
Server = http://archlinux.cs.nctu.edu.tw/$repo/os/$arch
Include = /etc/pacman.d/mirrorlist

[extra]
Server = http://archlinux.cs.nctu.edu.tw/$repo/os/$arch
Include = /etc/pacman.d/mirrorlist

#[community-testing]
#Include = /etc/pacman.d/mirrorlist

[community]
Server = http://archlinux.cs.nctu.edu.tw/$repo/os/$arch
Include = /etc/pacman.d/mirrorlist

pacman -Syy

docs.title: Partitioning
docs.text:
lsblk

NAME        MAJ:MIN RM   SIZE RO TYPE MOUNTPOINTS
nvme0n1     259:0    0 931.5G  0 disk
├─nvme0n1p1 259:1    0     1G  0 part /boot           # EFI System
├─nvme0n1p2 259:2    0    16M  0 part
├─nvme0n1p3 259:3    0 730.5G  0 part                 # Windows 11 Partition
├─nvme0n1p4 259:4    0     8G  0 part [SWAP]          # Linux Swap
└─nvme0n1p5 259:5    0   192G  0 part /               # Linux Partition

and use cfdisk /dev/nvme0n1 to partition

mkswap /dev/nvme0n1p4
swapon /dev/nvme0n1p4
mkfs.ext4 /dev/nvme0n1p5

docs.title: Mount the file systems
docs.text:
mount /dev/nvme0n1p5 /mnt

mount --mkdir /dev/nvme0n1p1 /mnt/boot

pacstrap /mnt base linux linux-firmware vim

genfstab -U /mnt >> /mnt/etc/fstab
arch-chroot /mnt

docs.title: Set Time and Locale
docs.text:
ln -sf /usr/share/zoneinfo/Asia/Taipei /etc/localtime

vim /etc/locale.gen

# uncomment this line
en_US.UTF-8 UTF-8

locale-gen
echo LANG=en_US.UTF-8 > /etc/locale.conf

the name is the computer's name

echo myarch > /etc/hostname

vim /etc/hosts

127.0.0.1 localhost
::1 localhost
127.0.1.1 myarch

passwd

docs.title: Install Grub Boot Loader
docs.text:
pacman -S grub efibootmgr os-prober networkmanager wireless_tools wpa_supplicant iwd

systemctl enable NetworkManager
systemctl enable iwd

install grub:

grub-install --target=x86_64-efi --efi-directory=/boot --bootloader-id=GRUB

in /etc/default/grub, uncomment (this can be done by archlinux_install script):

GRUB_DISABLE_OS_PROBER=false

Generate grub config:

grub-mkconfig -o /boot/grub/grub.cfg

Note

After we reboot, we may see that there's no windows 11 option on grub menu, just log in Arch Linux, and type:

sudo grub-mkconfig -o /boot/grub/grub.cfg

docs.title: Add User
docs.text:
the name is the user's name

pacman -S sudo
useradd -m ian
passwd ian

usermod -aG wheel,audio,video,storage ian

EDITOR=vim visudo

uncomment this line

## Uncomment to allow members of group wheel to execute any command
%wheel ALL=(ALL:ALL) ALL

docs.title: Finish Arch Linux Installation
docs.text:
exit

umount /mnt

or

umount -l /mnt

shutdown now

docs.title: After Installation
docs.text:
connect wifi with nmtui or iwctl

After Installation

config terminal fonts

sudo pacman -S terminus-font
cd /usr/share/kbd/consolefonts/
setfont ter-d20b.psf.gz

in /etc/vconsole.conf

FONT=ter-d20b.psf.gz

in /etc/makepkg.conf

MAKEFLAGS="-j$(expr $(nproc) \+ 1)"

in /etc/pacman.conf

Color
ParallelDownloads = 5

[core]
Server = http://archlinux.cs.nctu.edu.tw/$repo/os/$arch
Include = /etc/pacman.d/mirrorlist

[extra]
Server = http://archlinux.cs.nctu.edu.tw/$repo/os/$arch
Include = /etc/pacman.d/mirrorlist

#[community-testing]
#Include = /etc/pacman.d/mirrorlist

[community]
Server = http://archlinux.cs.nctu.edu.tw/$repo/os/$arch
Include = /etc/pacman.d/mirrorlist

docs.title: Install Yay AUR Helper
docs.text:
sudo pacman -Syy

copy github ip to /etc/hosts:

140.82.114.3 github.com

sudo pacman -S base-devel git
git clone https://aur.archlinux.org/yay.git
cd yay
makepkg -si

docs.title: Install User Packages
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/zyrethor/archlinux_install
cd archlinux_install
./install.sh ## default install packages
./install.sh -s ## install system settings
./install.sh -a ## install additional packages
./install.sh -vm ## install vmware packages, after installation, reboot

If the installation takes too long, then lengthen sudo timeout, for example 60 min:

sudo EDITOR=vim visudo

Defaults env_reset, timestamp_timeout=60

docs.title: Wifi
docs.text: After installed Arch Linux, you can use iwd or nmtui to connect wifi.

docs.title: Customize Grub
docs.text:
sudo vim /etc/default/grub
GRUB_GFXMODE=1024x768

git clone https://github.com/vinceliuice/grub2-themes.git
cd grub2-themes
sudo ./install.sh -t stylish -s 2k

docs.title: Vmware
docs.text:
sudo systemctl start vmware-networks-configuration.service
sudo systemctl start vmware-networks.service
sudo modprobe -a vmw_vmci vmmon


sudo pacman -S open-vm-tools xf86-video-vmware xf86-input-vmmouse
sudo systemctl enable vmtoolsd.service vmware-vmblock-fuse.service

omf install eclm

nvm use 18
npm install -g tree-sitter-cli

docs.title: error: GPGME error: No data
docs.text:
sudo rm -r /var/lib/pacman/sync/
resource

docs.title: Neovim different indent
docs.text:
:set expandtab
:retab

docs.title: remove serial number in filename (notion backup)
docs.text:
file:
find . -type f -name "*.md" -exec perl-rename 's/ [0-9a-z]{32}//' {} +

folder:
#!/bin/bash
find . -type d -name "* *" | sort -r | while read -r dir; do
  newdir=$(echo "$dir" | sed 's/ [0-9a-z]{32}//')
  mv "$dir" "$newdir"
done

docs.title: chmod
docs.text:
only directories

find * -type d -exec chmod 755 {} +

only files

find * -type f -exec chmod 644 {} +

use fd to batch process, use -X instead of -x

fd -t d -X chmod 755 {}

fd -t f -X chmod 644 {}

docs.title: Convert Video Format
docs.text: ffmpeg -i test.webm -c copy test.mp4

docs.title: yt-dlp
docs.text:
download only audio

yt-dlp --extract-audio 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v='

it will select opus format (default)

if you want to select differnt format, use --audio-format

download only mp3

yt-dlp --extract-audio --audio-format mp3 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v='

docs.title: Repeat Key Speed
docs.text:
in ~/.xinitrc

xset r rate [delay] [rate]

xset r rate 200 20
